intro: Sirmuellera collina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sirmuellera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Sirmuellera collina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
